column1: Job Description

***THIS IS A REMOTE POSITION***ABOUT THE JOB:As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for ensuring high levels of accuracy within the 3rd party data ingestion process. You will support internal stakeholders that depend on you to confirm our brands’ reports align with our internal dashboards. As a result of your analysis, business leaders will be able to make confident data driven decisions that improve the businessRESPONSIBILITIES:Coordinate with multiple departments to resolve data discrepanciesMonitor and improve internal data quality and data processing flowAssist with mapping external data sources into ConsumerAffairs data warehouseGather and document report requirements to ensure report accuracy and desired formatPerform data validation and analysesAbility to consume & work with large amounts of data & prepare reports and data visualization based on analytics to provide business insights(These responsibilities are not to be construed as a complete statement of all duties performed. Employees will be required to perform other job related duties as required)RequirementsEducation/Licensure/Certification:Bachelor’s Degree in analytics, business, mathematics, data science, BI or related field or equivalent work experienceExperience:Google Sheets and/or Microsoft Excel proficiency is requiredAbility to leverage large data setsSQL knowledge is preferredExperience with data visualization tools such as Qlikview, Tableau or Power BI is preferredAttention to detail and consistent delivery of accurate workKnowledge, skills and abilities:Must appreciate a fast-paced environment with the ability to prioritize and multitask.Stands up for decisions, takes responsibility for results, and shares both good and bad outcomes transparently.Demonstrates a relentless focus on results with a commitment to deliver; Always starts with a "Let's go GRIND it out" attitude.Takes decisive action, and confidently changes course if unsuccessfulDisplays a growth mindset to continually improve; encourages everyone around them to to be tenacious and never settle.Constantly seeks feedback to improve; Focussed on solving issues,Acts with urgency; delivers top results in hours and days instead of weeks and months.Relentless in their pursuit of success and possesses the willpower to embrace challenges as opportunities.CORE VALUES:(our daily GRIND)GENERATE OWNERSHIPResponsibility creates the freedom to quickly deliver value, we make no excuses, and consistently improve results.RESOLVE THROUGH DATAWe make data-driven decisions, think systematically about ROI and resolve complexity to drive resultsINVENT WITH GRITWe are intellectually curious, create, take smart risks and grind out results because Fortune Favors the Bold.NETWORK TO WINWe foster diversity, build trust through collaboration, close the loop, get to the bottom-line and turn debate into action and results.DELIVER IMPACT DAILYWe grind it out deliver important work, are efficient, have a relentless sense of urgency and drive resultsPHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS AND ENVIRONMENTAL CONDITIONS:Location: RemoteFrequency of travel: Occasional travel may be required for meetings, training and/or conferences.Light physical activities and efforts required in working within an office environment.(Reasonable accommodations will be made in accordance with existing ADA requirements for otherwise qualified individuals with disabilities.)ConsumerAffairs does not discriminate in admission or access to, or treatment or employment in its programs and activities on the basis of race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, marital status, disability, genetic information or any other reason prohibited by law.BenefitsHealth Care Plan (Medical, Dental & Vision)Retirement Plan (401k)Life Insurance (Basic, Voluntary & AD&D)Paid Time Off (Vacation, Sick & Public Holidays)Family Leave (Maternity, Paternity)Short Term & Long Term DisabilityTraining & DevelopmentWork From HomeFree Food & SnacksStock Option Plan

We believe work is not a place, but rather a thing you do. Our technology revolves around this core philosophy. We are relentlessly committed to helping people work and play from anywhere, on any device. Innovation, creativity and a passion for ever-improving performance drive our company and our people forward. We empower the original mobile device: YOU!What we're looking for:You are a curious, motivated, and passionate Enterprise Data Analyst who has a preferred 3-4 years’ experience working with financial billing and/or optimization data from public cloud hosting providers (Azure, AWS, Google).You will be responsible for analyzing monthly consumption data with the goal of identifying cost savings and optimization strategies across public cloud hosting and software/SaaS technology providers including Microsoft/Azure, AWS, Google, Oracle, SAP, and many other enterprise technology mega-vendors. Additionally, you will partner with and educate global Citrix stakeholders (across Engineering, Finance, IT, Sales) on how to interpret cloud services consumption data and leverage new services/pricing from vendors.Position summary:As an Enterprise Cloud Services and Software Data Analyst you will support optimization and cost savings strategies across 3rd party enterprise cloud hosting and software/SaaS technology providers. You will also work within and contribute to the Procurement departments goals & objectives and will be relied upon for your analytical expertise around data driven decision making. in this role you will utilize multiple sources of data to ensure compliance to contracts, policies and practices while employing Procurement processes and tools to identify potential value realization opportunities across multiple global functional departments.Primary Duties / Responsibilities:Function as a source of truth for cloud services consumption, pricing and cost optimization.Work closely with internal stakeholders and vendors to monitor the performance of newly deployed cloud services to ensure financial and cost optimization targets are achieved.Respond to ad-hoc data analysis requests and develop self-service reporting processes.Partner with data architects and data stewards to identify and define new enterprise data requirements to support optimization objectives.Monitor progress of multiple cloud optimization programs including a Reserve Instance (RI) purchase program (to ensure long running cloud services are optimized for price and performance).Support Global Category Manager with respect to the software category strategy; responsibilities include: management of portfolio of enterprise software/SaaS license and maintenance contract renewals, license and spend analysis to support new software/SaaS purchases and contract renewals, data gathering and analysis to support vendor negotiations, and/or contract management, execution of spend rationalization and cost savings strategies.Proactively work to identify new opportunities to provide valuable data insights to Procurement’s business partners and senior leaders.Preferred Qualifications:Experience working with technology vendor licensing/spend dataKnowledge of complex vendor software contracts, licensing terminology, and software licensing rights, especially for major software publishers (i.e. Salesforce, SAP, Microsoft).Must be able to interpret, analyze, & summarize contracts, and evaluate pricing & licensing proposals.Experience working with cloud platform management (CMP) tools desiredHighly skilled at Microsoft Excel (Pivot tales, vlookups, macros)Experienced at working with large data setsData analysis and query writing (using SQL or other data query languages/tools)Experience analyzing and breaking down problems and information using structured frameworks and methodologiesCurious and proactive problem solver, able to use data tools to detect and solve issues effectivelyPassionate about data, loves to find solutions to problems by combing through data, superior attention to detail.Demonstrated ability to work independently and collaboratively across the organization.Able to multi-task and prioritize across competing prioritiesStrong verbal/written communication skills.Strong collaboration skills with all levels of the organization including Legal and IT functional teams.Strong soft skills (communication, creative thinking, work ethic, teamwork, networking, problem solving and critical thinking).Strong interpersonal and communication skills and the ability to work effectively with a wide range of cross functional teams in a diverse community.Ability to exercise good judgment in evaluating situations and offering business recommendations.Basic Qualifications:Requires advanced knowledge of job area typically obtained through advanced education combined with experience. May have practical knowledge of project management.Requires a University Degree or equivalent experience and minimum 3 years of prior relevant experience; or a Master’s degree with 1 years; or a PhD without experienceIn other words, if you have an In-depth knowledge of Procurement and we just described you, then we’d love to talk!LI-MB2What you’re looking for:Our technology is built on the idea that everyone should be able to work from anywhere, at any time, and on any device. It’s a simple philosophy that guides everything we do — including how we work. If you’re driven, passionate and curious, we invite you to make a difference with a brand you can believe in. We want employees to do what they do best, every day.Be bold. Take risks. Imagine a better way to work. If we just described you, then we really need to talk.Functional Area:Purchasing Management (Procurement)About us:Citrix is a cloud company that enables mobile workstyles. We create a continuum between work and life by allowing people to work whenever, wherever, and however they choose. Flexibility and collaboration is what we’re all about. The Perks: We offer competitive compensation and a comprehensive benefits package. You’ll enjoy our workstyle within an incredible culture. We’ll give you all the tools you need to succeed so you can grow and develop with us.Citrix Systems, Inc. is firmly committed to Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) and to compliance with all federal, state and local laws that prohibit employment discrimination on the basis of age, race, color, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, ethnicity, national origin, citizenship, religion, genetic carrier status, disability, pregnancy, childbirth or related medical conditions, marital status, protected veteran status and other protected classifications.Citrix uses applicant information consistent with the Citrix Recruitment Policy Notice at https://www.citrix.com/about/legal/privacy/citrix-recruitment-privacy-notice.htmlCitrix welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Reasonable accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. If you are an individual with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the job application process, please contact us at (877) 924-8749 or email us at ASKHR@citrix.com for assistance.If this is an evergreen requisition, by applying you are giving Citrix consent to be considered for future openings of other roles of similar qualifications.

Who is Foodbuy?We are the industry leader in procurement and supply chain solutions. We are the subsidiary to the 6th largest company in the world (Compass Group PLC), yet Foodbuy has the feel of a small entrepreneurial Company. We pride ourselves on our ability to source and provide a variety of products and services that help our customers more easily, and cost effectively, run their businesses. We work with clients in the Hospitality, Restaurant, Healthcare, Education, Entertainment, and Gaming industries, and of course we support Compass Group- which is the world’s largest contract food and support services provider.Why Foodbuy?We care about our associates, our clients, and our community. We think big, encourage innovation and debate, and seek out game changers. Our benefits and PTO offerings are strong. Our compensation packages are competitive. And we are constantly growing, and we want our associates’ careers to grow along with us. We have an open and modern work environment, believe in flexibility, and promote a collaborative open door environment.Additionally, we follow a value system called FORT, which stands for Flexibility, Optimistic, Resourceful, and Transparent. FORT is the foundation for everything we do at Foodbuy. It is how we behave and interact with our clients, business partners and fellow associates.#FoodbuyPLEASE NOTE:Positions at this location require a COVID-19 vaccination. Where permitted by law, applicants who are offered a position for this location will be asked about their vaccination status, which must meet minimum business requirements. All religious, medical, or other legally recognized exemptions regarding vaccination status will be considered.***This position will be based in our Alpharetta, GA or Charlotte, NC office, but full-time remote candidates will be considered with the exception of CO.***Job SummaryThe Market Data Analyst will support the Member Development Group Vice Presidents, Account Managers and specifically designated channels of business through creating & maintaining detailed reporting assignments/applications. The Market Data Analyst is responsible for managing multiple projects and assignments by generating insights & analyzing information to help the organization better understand the past, envision the future, and steward our financial resources in the best way possible. This role will focus on understanding key stakeholder questions across the business in order to design and create reports/dashboards and reports that transform data into meaningful, actionable insights. This role will require creativity, an analytical skillset and clear communication to tell compelling stories about how our business is performing. You will also assist in automation of reports and dashboards, develop and maintain key metrics and scorecards, communicate findings, and train others on how to leverage the provided data across the business. This role is responsible for adhering to established processes and standards that have been put in place.Tactical DetailAnalyze Reporting and Compliance tools using Excel by developing Business Reviews, creating analytical assessments, establishing performance measurements, and developing variance analysis for customers.Understand aspects of Foodservice GPO’s manufacturer and distributor contracts, review analysis on competitiveness of Foodbuy programs and recommend program changes to maintain competitivenessPrepare key business analysis to assist functional leaders in decision-making processes. Investigate trends and variances compared to prior periods and forecastAd hoc financial analysis and special projects to support continued growth of businessFormulate new methodologies to drive efficiencies in reporting and analysisAssist in the preparation and presentation of reporting metrics to senior management, business stakeholders and key ClientsPrepare executive level summaries based on analysisRecipe to Succeed:PASSION for food and product procurement !!!Ability to educate and manage daily workloadsAbility to set goals and timelines without direct supervisionDetail-oriented and Analytical problem solving skillsFlexible/Adapts well to changeCoordinate and organize resources in efficient and effective ways to accomplish larger strategies and goalsStrong verbal and written communications skillsCustomer service focus: Values customers. Meet or exceed their requirements and be consistent with business prioritiesGenerate innovative, “out of the box” approaches and improved solutions that help create incremental gains in business resultsConsistently displays strong integrity and ethicsSupplier and customer interaction experiencePurchasing/procurement experienceDistribution or foodservice experience is preferredNecessary Ingredients:Advanced Knowledge of Microsoft Excel, Access, Word and PowerPoint are requiredAttention to details is a must and understanding of data integrity is keyAbility to grasp Data Management Applications (or experience with other rebate / contract management technology) is preferredBachelor’s degreeAbility to successfully manage concurrent projects and meet department deadlinesExcellent communication and customer relationship skills are requiredExcellent written communication skills are requiredAdvanced knowledge of data modeling, relational database structures and ability to mold datasets would be beneficialHospitality or Supply Chain knowledge is preferredMust be able to travel 1 week per month and additional travel when neededApply to Foodbuy today!Foodbuy is a member of Compass Group USAClick here to Learn More about the Compass StoryCompass Group is an equal opportunity employer. At Compass, we are committed to treating all Applicants and Associates fairly based on their abilities, achievements, and experience without regard to race, national origin, sex, age, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other classification protected by law.

Data AnalystThis is an excellent full-time and remote opportunity for an experienced Data Analyst.We'd love to hear from you to tell you more about our industry leading benefits, as well as the team that will be dedicated to helping you achieve your career goals from start to finish!Required Experience: This position requires a technical training in Information Technology and Cyber Security and hands-on experience as a programmer, data analyst or computer script writer in a multi-user production environment.Experience performing data extract, transformation, validation and load operations for business systems to meet production schedulesMust have experience with Oracle, ETL using SQL, and PythonCybersecurity Workforce certificate: Security+, others that qualify are CCNA Security, CySA+, GICSP, GSEC, CND, SSCP, CAP, CASP+CE, CISM, CISSP (or Associate), GSLC, and CCISOMust have secret clearance at a minimumPreferred Experience: Experience with Informatica and/or Data ServicesPostGres and/or RedshiftExperience in SAP Business Intelligence (BI) and BODS along with tools within SAP BIIn accordance with contractual requirements, employment and continued employment is contingent upon obtaining and maintaining a background investigation qualifying to hold a Position of Public Trust, which will be decided at the discretion of the federal government.Job Description: Perform research and be the Subject Matter Expert (SME) for AWS Cloud technologies to include Redshift, RDS Oracle, Data Lakes, Amazon EMR, AWS Glue, and AWS S3. Be able to make recommendations within the full spectrum of building Data Lakes and be able to recommend using one technology versus the others.Responsible for establishing Data Lakes and collaborating with team to populate data and pull data from various automated Business Objects Data Services (BODS).Perform Informatica Development as needed as Informatica team member. Have experience with TOAD Editor to be used for Informatica development.*US Citizens and all other parties authorized to work in the US are encouraged to apply. We are unable to sponsor or work on a Corp-to-Corp basis. *Modulant provides a competitive benefits package including health, dental, vision, 401k plan and paid time off.Modulant is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants, who are eligible for employment, will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, status as a protected veteran, or status as a qualified individual with disabilities. Modulant does not require, request, suggest, or cause an employee or prospective employee to take or submit to a lie detector test.Work environment and physical demands/general office environment, including ability to:See and read computer screensConcentrate for long periodsRemain in a sedentary positionSit for long periodsCommunicate via computer and telephone, and/orLift and move computer equipmentSalary will be negotiable with experience.Job Type: Full-timePay: From $65,000.00 per yearBenefits:401(k)401(k) matchingDental insuranceDisability insuranceHealth insuranceHealth savings accountLife insurancePaid time offVision insuranceSchedule:8 hour shiftMonday to FridayEducation:Bachelor's (Preferred)Work Location:Fully RemoteWork Remotely:YesWork Location: Remote

Data AnalystWorks Remotely – NationalNatural products is what we do. It’s who we are. Presence Marketing is an independently owned natural food broker that was born from a desire to work in a dynamic and environmentally conscious industry working in communicative partnerships with other like-minded companies. We are passionate, high energy, have strong standards and vision and are committed to making natural and organic food the standard again. We love to learn, are on-trend and care about our teams and their well-being.A little about this role:The Data Analyst is primarily responsible for the production and delivery of retail measurement reporting to both internal and external customers. The Data Analyst is also responsible for the development of reporting templates and infrastructure.A day in the life:Report design & development – building out reports/reporting environments to meet the evolving needs of internal and external customers.Production & delivery of ad hoc data requests – supporting the one-off reporting needs of both internal and external customers.Production/delivery of scheduled reporting – assist in the planning, production & delivery scheduled reporting for both internal and external customers.Educate users – answer questions on which reports to use to answer common business questions, help users navigate available reporting, outline rules/releasabilty of provided reporting as well as helping users understand structures of available data suppliers.Maintain – Ensure reporting environments, schedules, distribution lists and templates remain current.This job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Projects and responsibilities may change at any time with or without notice due to our business, industry, and/or market changes. Travel may be required for industry tradeshows, team meetings and/or company meetings and events.What we are looking for:Strong understanding of retail measurement data capabilities and measuresAdvanced knowledge of Microsoft ExcelAdvanced knowledge of Microsoft Power BIBase understanding of SQL (Structured Query Language) or aptitude to learnWorking knowledge of Microsoft Office suiteAttention to detail and strong organizational skillsAbility to work independently while being a strong team playerAbility to present findings to all levels within an organizationDependable, diplomatic person, able to problem-solve successfully with a wide variety of people and issuesFlexibility to successfully multi-task in a fast-paced environment with a positive attitudeSelf-motivatedAbility to manage time and deadlinesKnowledge and interest of the natural products/brands and retail landscape is a plus

Associated Bank is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse workforce. We support a work environment where colleagues are respected and given the opportunity to perform to their fullest potential. We consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, religion, color, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status, among other factors. Applicants with a disability who need assistance applying for a position with Associated Bank are asked to email: careers@associatedbank.comJob SummaryThe primary focus is to assist in the tactical operations of developing, delivering and supporting the business intelligence (BI) function within the Corporate Intelligence group. Responsible for coordinating with Business Intelligence Data Analyst's to determine BI/Analytics requirements and assist in the design and implementation of solutions under direction from the Business Intelligence Development Manager - Corporate Intelligence.Job AccountabilitiesDevelop technical solutions including queries, stored procedures, ETL packages and automations that are in alignment with agreed upon Corporate Intelligence and IT Operations policy.Work with the business intelligence data analysts to determine requirements for reporting and analytical needs of the business.Assist in development of reports, dashboards, cubes and other information tools as needed.Perform tasks such as data mapping, data validation, code reviews and documentation.Assist in daily maintenance and modifications to existing processes.EducationBachelor's Degree or equivalent combination of education and experience MIS, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or equivalent degree RequiredExperienceLess than 2 years Technology related focusing on database development, reporting and business intelligence. Database management, SQL Server, SSIS, SSAS, SSRS, Cognos, data warehouse, data modeling. Required1-3 years SQL Server and/or SSIS experience preferredCompliance StatementFully complies with all applicable enterprise policies and procedures. Acts in compliance with all applicable laws and regulations as outlined in training materials, including but not limited to Bank Secrecy Act. Responsible for reporting suspicious activity to Financial Intelligence. Responsible to report all customer complaints as prescribed and procedure violations to management or HR. Responsible to report ethical concerns as needed to Associated’s anonymous Ethics Hotline.Associated Bank is committed to working diligently with any colleague who needs an accommodation perform the essential functions of the job. Please contact the Leaves & Accommodations office to request an accommodation.

Associate Product Manager – Data Analyst177460BRWhen you’re part of the team at Thermo Fisher Scientific, you’ll do important work, and you’ll be valued and recognized for your performance. With talented managers and inspiring coworkers to support you, you’ll find the resources and opportunities to make significant contributions to the world.How you will make an impact:As an Associate Product Manager – Data Analyst you will work in close collaboration with the GPS Product Management team to coordinate the data integrity of all product information across the company’s various ERP and reporting systems, maintain customer facing web assets and participate in market surveillance to support business growth objectives. The position has a focus on enhancing customer experience by ensuring the accuracy and availability of product data and collaboration with multiple cross functional teams (finance, data science product / commercial management and marketing communications ) to develop and execute programs to drive data reliability and completeness.*Position may require Covid-19 vaccination and/or routing testing, per client discretion*Where will you work:The Associate Product Support Manager position could be remotely based in the Boston, MA, Asheville, NC or Frederick MD areas.What will you do:Support key business unit initiatives as required in:Manage web and e-Commerce information and analytics for specified productsMonitor and manage accuracy of product data for reporting purposesMaintain global pricing files across a thriving business unitAdministrate and optimize team intranet resourcesInternal and external market surveillance activitiesHow you will get here:Education:Bachelor’s Degree is requiredExperience, Knowledge, Skills, Abilities:Experience with web/data analyticsEffective communicator with excellent oral and written communications skillsStrong organizational and time management skillsCollaborative worker with skill set in process improvementAbility to travel when neededYou will report to:Sr. Global Business Director with regular collaboration with multiple product managers (CO2 incubation, Biological Safety Cabinets and Clean Air and Laboratory Shakers), in a dynamic environment serving cutting edge scientific research including the fast growing Cell and Gene Therapy marketAt Thermo Fisher Scientific, each one of our 80,000 extraordinary minds has a unique story to tell. Join us and contribute to our singular mission—enabling our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer.

PositionOverviewTheMarketing Data Analyst supports the reporting and analysis for all media teams.Responsibilities include designing campaign performance reports and maintainingexisting reports; performing ad hoc analysis to identify trends; and buildingtools and providing resources to facilitate all the above. We are looking for someonewith a keen understanding of statistics and the intellectual curiosity toexplore unfamiliar concepts. The candidate should be comfortable with selectingappropriate methods to interpret complex data sets and visualizing theirfindings.ResponsibilitiesDesign, execute, anddeliver marketing performance reports, dashboards, and analysis in response toclient needsDevelop tools andprocesses to automate common reporting and analytics tasks, e.g. writing APIqueries to retrieve data from media buying platformsWork with clientaccount teams to translate client analytics requests into action plans anddeliverablesManipulate, clean, andvisualize data using Excel, MySQL, Tableau, and similar toolsSkillsand QualificationsRequired:Expert Excel skills:manipulating, parsing, and blending data is essentialProficiency with SQL,Javascript, Python, or other programming languagesAbility to efficientlyanalyze and provide insight into complex data setsComfortable working ina fast-moving environment with shifting prioritiesExcellent quantitativeand critical thinking skills1-2 years’ experiencein an analytically driven rolePreferred:Experience with Tableauor other BI toolsPrevious experience inthe digital media or marketing industryDegree in aquantitative field (engineering, computer science, physics, mathematics,statistics)**100% remote, WeWork spaces are an option.About Mediasmith:We are an independent media agency instilling thoughtful strategy and digital expertise into media implementation and analytics. Mediasmith makes impactful media simple. Mediasmith, an equal opportunity employer, offers competitive salary packages and a full range of benefits in a pleasant and very casual environment. We are only able to respond to candidates selected for interviews

Wheels is a last-mile, shared electric vehicle platform changing the current landscape in last mile mobility. Our products range from a shared rental marketplace to personal ownership and anything in between. We are a low cost, energy efficient way to get from point A to point B… and then some.While we're headquartered in Los Angeles California, we're also embracing remote work across the U.S. We hope you're ready for the ride of your life. As our Data Analyst, you’ll be on the ground floor of a small and growing data team. As a small company, you will not only have the opportunity to work on data, but you will also assist in making decisions using data. This is a high visibility role - you will frequently be interfacing with senior leaders of the company, including the CEO. You are paving the way for Wheels to make quality, data-driven decisions across every vertical of the company.Note: we are not sponsoring candidates for a green card or visa at this time.What You’ll Do:Develop tools and analyze data with high visibility to CEO and senior leadershipDefine and analyze key metric indicators to assist in making crucial business decisions that directly influence revenues, costs, and profitsPartner and collaborate cross-functionally with Finance, Product, Engineering, and Operations on critical organizational, strategic, and operational projects to increase business efficiencyDirectly help operations teams assist make data-driven decisionsWhat You’ll Need:1+ years total experience in a quantitative role, preferably in a startup environmentProficiency in SQL (CTEs, window functions, etc)Experience with data visualization toolsAbility to conduct statistical analysis such as hypothesis testing and regressionExperience with accounting and finance a plus

POSITION TITLEOperations Administrator & Data AnalystLOCATION1150 W. Adams, Chicago IL, 60607POSITION STRUCTUREReports To: Pastor of Operations & Expansion, Dave DavisCategory: Full TimeWork schedule: SU-THOur MissionWe are a local church with a global mission to lead people into transforming relationships with Jesus. The heart behind everything we do is to lead an Only God movement that transforms the soul, the city, and the world. We aim to partner with the Holy Spirit in creating moments that lead to movement so that people can come, connect, contribute, and change. We are committed to working with excellence as we seek to create a 7 >1 daily transforming environment where everyone is both accepted and expected to grow in a holistic (heart, mind, body, soul) way.POSITION SUMMARYThe Operations Administrator & Data Analyst role provides organizational excellence and accurate data for both the Operations Team, and Soul City Church as a whole. This position works with the Pastor of Operations and Expansion to provide accurate, clean, and well organized data for Soul City Church, as well as oversees and maintains the church’s informational database, Planning Center. The Operations Administrator and Data Analyst is responsible for analyzing and organizing data in a creative and detail oriented manner for the purpose of advancing Soul City’s mission with clarity and vision.This role is in charge of calendar and event management for the Facilities Team in order to ensure a hospitable experience for outside rentals, as well as help the ministries of Soul City Church maximize our space to the fullest when it comes to internal scheduling. Finally, the Operations Administrator & Data Analyst works closely alongside the Operations team to provide the necessary administrative support to keep our facilities running smoothly.KEY RESPONSIBILITIESResponsibility Percentage of TimeManage and ensure data integrity and analytics, 40%including the oversight of Planning Center andGrow reports.Oversee calendar and event management for 25%Soul City Operations.Provide administrative support to the Operations. 35%Team.POSITION REQUIREMENTSCOMPETENCIESInforming: Provides the information people need to know to do their jobs; provides individuals information so that they can make accurate decisions; is timely with information.Organizing: Can marshal resources (people, funding, material, support) to get things done; can orchestrate multiple activities at once to accomplish a goal; uses resources effectively and efficiently arranges information and files in a useful manner.Analytics: Can review and analyze numerical data, establish trends and narratives from the data and provide forecasting based on historical data.Problem Solving: Uses rigorous logic and methods to solve difficult problems with effective solutions; can see hidden problems; is excellent at honest analysis; looks beyond the obvious and doesn't stop at the first answers.Process Management: Good at figuring out the processes necessary to get things done; knows how to organize people and activities; understands how to combine tasks into efficient work flow; knows what to measure and how to measure it; gets more out of fewer resources.Managing Through Systems: Can design processes and procedures which allow managing from a distance; can make things work through others without being there; can impact people and results remotely.EXPERIENCEDatabase managementData analysisPlanning Center experience preferredEDUCATIONBachelor's DegreePOSSIBLE SPIRITUAL GIFTSAdministrationHelpsHospitalityKnowledge

Job Description:You are kind, curious, and enjoy enabling sound data-based decision-making using your combined skills and/or experience in business analytics, data visualization, and data engineering.Maybe you delight in turning technical support data into feedback for product teams, or perhaps you love reducing duplication of effort by developing automated analytics solutions. In any case, you love having ample opportunities to blend your many skillsets in consultation, communication, presentations and data visualization and create insights that inform your organization's strategy.You are comfortable engaging directly to global business leaders to understand their objectives and how they can measure key results. You enjoy developing focused action plans after analyzing data in context.You prefer to manage multiple projects simultaneously. You are happy working with a kind, fun, energetic and close-knit, yet distributed team and you appreciate integrity in your colleagues and company.Responsibilities:You will strive to reduce complexity and deliver simple, beautiful, automated data solutions.Gather requirements from stakeholders to understand what is being requested and what is ultimately needed to meet the business challenge and deliver outcomes aligned to Client's data transformation.Analyze and document existing, "as is? data / reporting flows using multiple techniques and methods and provide coaching to stakeholders to gain agreement on the "to be” options and outcomes.Develop reporting models and batch queries using data mining languages (SQL/PLSQL, R, Python, etc.) as part of your role in leading complex data analysis to develop, track, and maintain key metrics, ensuring alignment across team and stakeholders.Create wireframes and mockups based on requirements and present data strategy meetings where you will continue to inquire and coach for best results.Develop effective and attractive executive-level analytics dashboards that communicate and enable business insights and recommendations for the relevant data story.Troubleshoot production issues and resolve them quickly with little assistance.Celebrate success and recognize those who helped to make it possible.Requirements:4+ years of hands-on experience (this may include your college education) in data analytics in one or more of the following areas: Technical Support, Customer Service, Customer Success, Sales Operations, Product ManagementExpert level in data extraction, designing simple and beautiful dashboards / visualizations, and automation using Python, DBMS, SQL, Tableau, Power BI or similarAbility to work both independently and/or collaboratively while mining large, complex organizational and business data sets to find and fix issues, debug into anomalies and deliver useful insightsExperience using Excel, Python, R and other mechanisms to cleanse and aggregate dataBonus points for knowledge of machine learning techniques, experience with R, etc.Bachelor's degree, preferably in Computer Science / MIS or higher degree in Data Science, Analytics, Statistics, Computer Science, Applied Math or similarJob Types: Full-time, ContractPay: $54.00 - $54.84 per hourBenefits:401(k)Dental insuranceHealth insuranceVision insuranceSchedule:8 hour shiftMonday to FridayExperience:SQL DBMS: 1 year (Preferred)dashboards / visualizations: 1 year (Preferred)Python and Visualizatio in Tableau and Power BI: 1 year (Preferred)Work Location:Fully RemoteWork Location: Remote

Who we areBioDigital has built the first cloud platform for visualizing the human body in interactive 3D. Similar to Google Earth, but for the human body, our cutting edge technology is used on a global scale by patients and professionals who need a more engaging, visual format for learning about health and medicine. Our unique team is leveraging this work to achieve our mission of improving global health literacy and we are seeking a talented Business Intelligence Analyst to help execute on our ambitious goals.Who you areBioDigital is looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst with complex problem solving skills and deep technical expertise to create rich reports and data visualizations that enable leaders across the business to quickly digest data and make decisions. You will be responsible for ensuring that analytics at BioDigital solve critical business problems and for maintaining a high level of quality and consistency of business data flowing into and across the business. The OpportunityTackle real problems with large data sets as part of a small but high-performing team within a fast-paced, high growth business. Media Players is on a mission to become the world's leading provider of data-driven sports marketing and analytics. We combine data science with marketing psychology and world-class media execution to drive measurable engagement for our clients and partners. The Data Team works hand-in-glove with the Marketing Team to provide the core assets needed for microtargeted campaigning (e.g. custom segmentation, predictive scoring, attribution models), while also acting as a ‘skunkworks' that continually innovates with the most powerful data and technology available to provide a competitive edge for the business.This is an exceptional opportunity for a Data Analyst seeking to apply their technical skills to solve real-world problems and gain a diversity of experience at the intersection of marketing and data science. The role involves data exploration, visualisation, reporting automation, hypothesis testing, predictive modelling and back-testing, and offers the opportunity for career development into either a team leader or technical specialist.ResponsibilitiesInterface with research managers and marketeers and respond to the analysis needs of the market in order to drive high impact customer acquisition.Use best-in-class tooling to build dashboards and visualisations to track the performance of holistic campaigns.Automate and streamline data ingestion and reporting processes.Devote part of your time to R&D to develop novel technical strategies to improve the performance of campaigns. Follow your intellectual curiosity and don't be afraid to take risks.Act as a technical subject matter specialist within a multidisciplinary team of researchers, data scientists, engineers and marketeers.Be responsible for documentation of reporting, processes and systems.Maintain a strong level of technical knowledge, and be aware of any new technical developments that may benefit the business.RequirementsAn advanced degree in a quantitative discipline (e.g. Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Engineering) or equivalent experience.At least 1 year in a hands-on data analyst role. Past experience with digital marketing campaigns and the associated modelling, analytics, and automated reporting highly desirable.Experience working with data from modern marketing and advertising platforms (e.g. DMPs, DSPs) highly desirable.Extensive experience with SQL and relational databases.Experience with Python and associated data science libraries (e.g. Pandas, sci-kit learn) a plus.Excellent written and verbal communication skills, and capable of explaining complex concepts to people from a variety of technical backgrounds.Ability to work independently or as part of a team, and able to work well with other disciplines (e.g. marketeers, applications developers).Experience applying abstract mathematical concepts to noisy, biased or incomplete datasets.Entrepreneurial drive and the desire to contribute to building an early stage company.Ability to balance multiple projects, often with simultaneous and competing deadlines.*** Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States for any employer ***

Over 20 years ago, Stride was founded to provide personalized learning — powered by technology. We reached students where they were in their own journeys. We knocked down their barriers to great education. And we gave every learner equal opportunity to succeed — however they defined success. Stride innovated the learning experience with online and blended learning that prepared them for their lives ahead.No matter their age, wealth, or environment, every learner possesses unique talents and boundless potential. Every learner is ready to be inspired by a great education. While many students thrive in traditional brick-and-mortar schools, others are limited by a system that simply doesn't fit their needs. Stride is establishing the kind of personal learning that everyone can access.Whether providing students with unique opportunities for growth or empowering educators with the tools and knowledge they need to succeed, we know personalized education works. We're steadfast in our dedication to the entire education community. And we're energized to best serve every learner, educator, and enterprise. This philosophy demands a culture driven by an earned trust, constant improvement, and creative innovation. We are Multiverse, a tech startup with a social mission. We’re building an outstanding alternative to university and corporate training, to develop a diverse group of future leaders. Our impact focuses on three core areas: measuring potential beyond academics, delivering world-class job-focused training via applied learning, and helping diverse groups of young people build social capital through a thriving community.We are one of the fastest-growing businesses in Europe and also rapidly expanding in North America, working with over 300 clients including Facebook, Morgan Stanley, KPMG, Kantar, Citi, and Microsoft.We started 2021 with the UK’s largest-ever EdTech funding round - a $44m Series B. At Seer, we pride ourselves on innovation; standing out among the rest and enabling our clients to do the same. We're a Digital Marketing Agency powered by Big Data to drive integrated, holistic strategy for our clients. We get excited at the thought of bringing together millions of data points from disparate data sets (including qualitative!) to drive empathy-fueled opportunities and insights. Big Data, automation, and problem solving at scale: it's what's for breakfast. Could this be love? Maybe.This is a part-time/contract opportunity with Seer's Paid Media team. All contract engagements start with a 3-month commitment and the opportunity to extend on a month-to-month basis thereafter.What about you? You’re data-obsessed and love solving problems at scale. You pay attention to the details without losing sight of the big picture. Quick to pick up patterns and patient enough to identify long-term trends. You’re detail-oriented, logical, and running head first towards the future of search.Here are some highlights of what you'll be doing...You’ll execute and measure the effectiveness of Seer’s Paid Media strategies through an integrated approach to search spanning various clientsYou’ll support Seer’s team & clients by helping research ad copy and keywords, developing recommendations, and launching campaigns. This can include creating/testing ad copy, research for keywords and negatives, development and launching of search campaigns across Google and Bing AdsYou’ll leverage big data to make account optimizations and keyword recommendations at scale. Rooting your analysis and client recommendations in both paid and organic dataYou will unlock new opportunities for clients and save hours of valuable time through automation and machine learning, leveraging Paid Media management platforms and analyzing data at scaleYou’ll spend your days in the data. Keeping client goals and target audiences top of mind, you pull insights from time of day data, geographic location, user's search funnel (and more!) to drive holistic, data-driven optimizations- maximizing ROI and saving clients money *cha-ching*We're big on knowledge sharing, and you are too!! You'll contribute to the Seer blog, industry forums, and grow your thought leadership skills from the ground upThe skills you'll bring to the table...Your exposure to Paid Media is rooted in Paid Search with extensive experience in Google Ads and Bing AdsYou take your client's success personally. It shines through your analysis of client performance- managing large data sets across multiple channels to protect your clients' dollars. Automation is your friend. Between Supermetrics and Google Data Studio, you keep a close pulse on pacing and never miss a beatYou know the world of Search changes fast! To keep pace, you're all over the latest emerging trends, tools, and technologies. Reading industry blogs and case studies- you always have the hottest 'haps queued up and ready to share with your teamNo doubt you’re results-oriented. Your killer attention to detail allows you to thoroughly analyze Big Data across disparate data sources, extracting valuable insights for your clientsEven though your role focuses largely on strategy implementation, you’re always eager to share your ideas- transforming technical insights into easily digestible recommendationsAdvanced skills with Microsoft Office, especially Excel, and the Google Suite. Savvy with data viz tools like Power BI or Tableau too? Say no more!Your top-notch time management skills allow you to juggle several projects at once without missing a beat. When faced with a challenge, you always rise to the occasion. You’re no stranger to working under pressure and you always find a way to meet deadlinesBonus PointsYou have an A+ in data literacy, with a baseline understanding of data sources and constructs, the basics of SQL, and more! Most importantly, you know when there's an opportunity at your fingertips and are quick to loop-in the resident Data Analyst & Engineer to make it a realityNot ready to apply but want to keep in touch? Stay connected via our monthly Career Update newsletter! We'll share curated content on Seer, open roles, industry insights, career advice, events you don't want to miss, and more (so you never miss a beat).Sometimes the best opportunities are hidden by self-doubt. We disqualify ourselves before we have the opportunity to be considered. Regardless of where you came from, how you identify, or the path that led you here- you are welcome. If you read this job description with a belly full of excitement, we’re just as excited about you. You have to apply though :)#LI-Remote

We are seeking new members of our Impact Analytics team to lead analytics for setting product strategy, supporting product development, and evaluating population health interventions with a focus on referral management and specialty care.The Data Analyst will be a key member of a cross functional team working to improve the quality, cost, and outcomes of specialty services for Aledade ACOs. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in health care referral analytics, an understanding of population health strategies, and a passion for having a direct impact on primary care practices and contributing to a data-driven organization.We are flexible with respect to geographic location, and the ideal candidate will be comfortable working remotely/work from home within the US.As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for:Designing and executing descriptive and predictive analyses to identify opportunities for improving referral management and specialty care delivery. Leveraging rich data sources including national Medicare claims, other payer claims, electronic health records, event notification, and patient-reported data.Distilling actionable insights from complex healthcare claims data, particularly in the area of office visit patterns, referral practices, and specialty care.Performing detailed drill-down analyses to identify drivers of medical cost trends.Serve as a subject matter expert on internal and external referral management and specialty care analytics data products.Evaluate impact of referral management interventions on outcomes including patient and provider experience, quality, utilization, and cost.Preferred qualifications:Deep experience with health care data sources, especially claims (Medicare, Medicaid, and commercial).Excellent quantitative analysis abilities, grounded in epidemiology, biostatistics, econometrics, health informatics, health care analytics or related field.Expertise in methods for measuring health care utilization, spending, quality, and outcomes; risk adjustment; provider profiling; and related analytical tasks. Experience using or building data products and methods such as episode groupers or clinical risk groupers.Experience designing and conducting rigorous, pragmatic evaluations of the impact of interventions on provider and patient experience, utilization, and total cost of care.Demonstrated ability to conduct nuanced analyses to produce accurate and unbiased results and tell the story of those results in data visualizations and reports.Experience in descriptive and predictive analysis methods, including regression and classification techniques.Advanced data manipulation skills, including a strong foundation in SQL programming.Intense attention to detail and data quality assurance.Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment and manage competing deadlines and priorities.Thinks beyond their immediate team and contributes to making Aledade holistically better (active engagement in D&I efforts, culture initiatives, facilitating training, leading roundtables, etc.)All prospective hires will be required to demonstrate that they have been fully vaccinated against COVID-19 with a COVID-19 vaccine for which the U.S. Food and Drug Administration has issued a license or an Emergency Use Authorization prior to mutually agreed upon start date at Aledade, unless they qualify for a medical or religious accommodation to this vaccination requirement.If you are passionate about transforming the healthcare system into one that best serves the needs of patients, doctors, and society, we’d love for you to join us!Who We Are:Aledade is a leader in population health that is using innovative, value based solutions to transform the way physicians interact with their patients. We are on a mission to change healthcare for the better and solve complex problems within the healthcare system.We follow the simple but radical idea that Aledade only succeeds when our partner practices succeed. From our cutting-edge technology platform to practice transformation services, we provide physicians with everything they need to create and run an accountable care organization (ACO), revamping the way they practice and getting them back to where they should be: quarterbacking their patients’ health care!Our customized solutions help clinicians in communities across America preserve their autonomy, deliver better care to their patients, reduce overall costs, and keep independent physician practices flourishing.What Does This Mean for You?At Aledade, you will be part of a creative culture that is driven by a passion for tackling complex issues with respect, open-mindedness, and a desire to learn. You will work with team members that bring a wide range of experiences, interests, backgrounds, beliefs, and achievements to their work, united by a shared passion for public health and a commitment to the Aledade mission.We’ve recently been recognized as a Top Workplace by The Washington Post, Best Workplace in HealthCare & Biopharma, Top 100 Best Small & Medium Workplaces, Glassdoor Best Places to Work, a Best and Brightest Companies to Work for in the Nation, a Tech Tribune 10 Best Tech Startups in Maryland and Bethesda, Best Tech for Good, Best Workplaces for Millennials, Best Workplaces for Women, Best Workplaces for Parents, and a 2020 Inno on Fire by DC Inno.That’s because the things that matter to you also matter to us!In addition to time off to support work-life balance and enjoyment, we offer the following comprehensive benefits package designed for the needs of our team-members:Flexible work schedules and ability to work remotely available for many rolesEducational Assistant ProgramRobust time off plan (21 days of PTO in your first year!)Paid Volunteer Days10 paid holidays12 weeks paid Parental Leave for all new parents6 weeks paid sabbaticalHealth, dental and vision insurance paid up to 80% for employees, dependents, and domestic partners401(k) with up to 4% matchStock optionsMonthly cell phone stipendWeekly catered lunchesJeans everyday workplaceGender neutral bathroomsAnd more!At Aledade, we don’t just accept differences, we celebrate them! We strive to attract, develop, and retain highly qualified individuals representing the diverse communities where we live and work. Aledade is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Employment policies and decisions at Aledade are based on merit, qualifications, performance, and business needs. All qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth or medical conditions related to pregnancy or childbirth), gender identity or expression, religion, physical or mental disability, medical condition, legally protected genetic information, marital status, veteran status, or sexual orientation.

MARKET RESEARCH DATA ANALYST / ENGINEERWe are a boutique market research firm that provides industry and investor clients with primary research on the mobile computing market. We measure, analyze, and predict smartphone, tablet and wearable sales using numerous data collection methodologies. Through our published reports and advisory services, our clients gain valuable insights into the macro and micro trends in the mobile industry. We are a small and dynamic firm with offices in the Old Oakland district.ROLE DESCRIPTION:We rely upon on our Data Analysts to structure, clean and manage our various data sources, create advanced visualizations for internal and external use and help write research reports. The analyst will help our organization provide our clients with timely, relevant, and actionable data and insights into key market trends. The Data Analyst is an expanding role that will require a candidate to have worked extensively with Tableau Prep and Python for a minimum of one year with each. This position will work both independently and as part of a team to help manage our large datasets, produce data-centric reports and help uncover the "why" behind the data. An ideal candidate will leverage a strong interest in using big data to understand consumer behavior, as well as an affinity for mobile technology.RESPONSIBILITIES:Maintain, organize and analyze primary and third-party datasets using Tableau, Tableau Prep, Python, MySQL and Excel.Create automated processes to align and merge internally created and externally sourced datasets into a single sourceCreate compelling visualizations within Tableau.Create custom dashboards within Tableau to assist our clientele in comparing data.Provide written insights and commentary to help simplify and explain complex trendsREQUIREMENTS (Minimum 2+ years experience in the following):Experience creating visualizations within Tableau and cleaning / merging data with Tableau Prep and Python.Experience with MySQL databases and joining large datasetsAdvanced Excel skills (eg pivot tables, lookup formulas, etc) including the ability to manipulate and manage large datasets.A Bachelor's degree with a solid GPA from a reputable four-year institution.Intellectual curiosity and a desire to understand the forces that are driving the trends in the data.Strong interpersonal skills; ability to listen closely to what’s being said and what’s not being said, and to pick up on non-verbal communication.Attention to detail is critical to success in this role. A candidate should place a considerable importance on the quality of their work and ensure the small yet important details are not missed.Organizational and time management skills and the ability to work productively and efficiently in a fast-paced environment with multiple projects and tight deadlines.A self-starter with the ability to work independently and manage their own workflow. A candidate should work well with minimal supervision and take ownership on project completion.Work as an effective, collaborative member within a small team environment. We all get our hands dirty and do whatever it takes to produce quality research.Please be advised we are unable to offer visa sponsorship for this position, but will consider exceptional international remote candidates.We provide competitive compensation based on experience, a performance bonus (up to 25% of base), health insurance, 401K, and Commuter Benefit options. Cover letter optional.Job Type: Full-timePay: $100,000.00 - $120,000.00 per yearCOVID-19 considerations:Working remotely until we can safely report back to our offices in Oakland, then we will be strictly on-siteJob Type: Full-timePay: $100,000.00 - $120,000.00 per yearBenefits:Health insurancePaid time offSchedule:Monday to FridaySupplemental Pay:Bonus payCOVID-19 considerations:Working remotely until we can safely report back to our offices in Oakland, CA, then our team, including this position, will be strictly on-siteEducation:Bachelor's (Preferred)Experience:SQL: 2 years (Required)Tableau: 2 years (Preferred)Python: 1 year (Required)Advanced Microsoft Excel: 2 years (Required)Work Location:One locationWork Remotely:YesWork Location: One location

About KrakenOur mission is to accelerate the adoption of cryptocurrency so that you and the rest of the world can achieve financial freedom and inclusion. In our first decade, Kraken has risen to become one of the largest, most successful and respected crypto exchanges on the planet.We are changing the way the world thinks about finance and our range of successful products are playing a critical role in the mainstream adoption of crypto assets. We continue to trail-blaze into new territory with the introduction of Kraken Bank, providing a more seamless integration between crypto and the traditional financial system. This makes us the first crypto company (ever) to be awarded a U.S. state banking charter.Our diverse group of 2,000+ Krakenites are distributed all over the world as part of our 'remote first' culture, united by a shared passion for delighting customers, upholding crypto values and achieving our meaningful mission. We attract people who push themselves to improve, are radically transparent and think differently in order to unlock their potential.Crypto is a rapidly evolving industry and we’re just getting started. We’re growing fast and you're invited to join the revolution!About the RoleThe Strategic Intelligence team works cross-functionally, focusing on competitive intelligence and performance benchmarking within the competitive landscape. As an Intelligence Data Analyst, you will be responsible for assisting the various teams with business and industry-related questions. Successful candidates will answer these broad, sometimes ambiguous questions by utilizing a variety of data sources available to the team.Additionally, this role will serve as a data consultant, helping various stakeholders understand what is possible from a data perspective and how to frame questions that can then be answered with existing data resources. You will also be responsible for building and maintaining a variety of regular reporting dashboards and reports. Lastly, you will be asked to assist our data engineers in developing and maintaining data integrations, as well as fixing data issues as they arise.You should be an ambitious and curious individual who is excited by the challenge of conducting research in a highly technical, yet rapidly developing industry. You will be expected to consume and analyze large amounts of data, including unstructured alternative data sources. You will also need to maintain a high degree of attention to detail with every project, as data integrity is critical for decision-making. Experience with SQL and Python are a must. Intellectual curiosity and a desire to learn everything about cryptocurrency are a requirement for this role.Your mission, should you choose to accept it, will be to bridge the gap between technical data engineers and business leaders, with both written and verbal communication. This is the most challenging, yet rewarding aspect of the role.This is a fully remote role, we will consider applicants based in North America, South America and Europe.ResponsibilitiesAssist stakeholders with answering business questions with dataDevelop dashboards for monitoring performance of various initiativesAssist with preparation of regular reporting materialsMaintain and improve existing dashboardsWork with data engineers to discover new data sources and develop integrationsAssist data engineers with maintain data sets and existing integrationsRequirementsBachelor’s degree in quantitative field and at least 2 year of relevant work experience in data analytics, marketing analytics, product analytics, or a similar capacityBackground in marketing, business, or product analyticsMeaningful experience writing SQL queriesExperience conducting data analysis in Python or similar languageStrong written and verbal communication skillsA team player that works well with various functions across the companyNice to haveTechnical understanding of crypto networksExperience with visualization tools including Superset and TableauExperience writing data pipelines in PythonExperience presenting to broad audiences of stakeholdersBackground working in a cross-functional role, supporting multiple teams with varying technical backgroundsLocation Tagging: #EU #USWe’re powered by people from around the world with their own unique backgrounds and experiences. We value all Krakenites and their talents, contributions, and perspectives.

In order to apply for a position at Lumeris, you must create an account using your email address and a password of your choosing. This account will allow you to receive notifications each step of the way through the job application process. With these updates, you’ll never have to wonder where you are in the process. Additionally, we can easily send pertinent documents to you for your review. Once you create the account, you may apply to any position you feel is a good fit without having to re-enter information. Thank you for your interest in Lumeris.Position: Associate Data Analyst (Remote - Nationwide)Position Summary: This role is expected to become a subject-matter expert on the organization, the Plans it supports, plan operations and functions, related regulatory requirements, and operational and regulatory reporting, including CMS audit universes. This role will assess the ability of others to investigate and address all aspects of the grievances, as well as monitor for adherence with company procedures and regulatory requirements.Job Description: Primary ResponsibilitiesUtilizes quantitative and qualitative analysis techniques within multiple domains and factors to assess case work, including data integrity (accuracy), case handling (appropriateness), documentation (precision), and resolution (completeness). Continues to dig for information beyond typical sources of data to validate data.Independently researches issues, assesses different data sets, derives common themes or trends, identifies specific risk factors, determines solutions, applies mitigation strategies to various scenarios identified in the data, and communicates with leadership and the broader organization. Demonstrates sufficient knowledge of complaint and understanding of related plan processes or functions to adequately articulate issue and resolution. Serves as primary point of contact for identified trends and issues.Employs innovative strategies and solutions to build team capabilities.Proactively identifies areas of improvement for self and the department and participates in the development and completion objectives and performance improvement initiatives.Ensures grievance resolution reflects the member’s complaint and accurately and completely addresses all components of the complaint.Develops and maintains various operational performance metrics to assess productivity and quality. Employs multiple monitoring techniques, methodologies, formats, and best practices to monitor and report on production metrics including volume, aging, and investigation status. Offers mentoring and best practices on investigative processes and case documentation.Builds and maintains good rapport and works effectively with individuals in all areas of the company, including working to identify the potential for broader impact and appropriate corrective actions for identified issues.Recognizes urgent and sensitive issues/incidents and escalates to management in a timely manner to facilitate appropriate and timely response.Communicates the status of assignments to leadership and team in weekly internal meetings for discussion and decision-making.QualificationsBachelor’s degree & 1+ years of related data analytics experience; Experience in Medicare Advantage, Appeals & Grievances, and/or other health plan operations (e.g., Claims, Customer Service, Enrollment) can be beneficialBasic expertise in analyzing data and working knowledge of analytical tools (e.g. Excel, Access, or other database and management systems)Strong sense of urgency and flexibility with the ability to prioritize competing priorities to meet tight deadlines, multi-task, and operate effectively in both remote and in-person settingsGood judgement, logical, analytical, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills with the ability to take on moderately complex problems and achieve a solution within a reasonable amount of timeInvestigatory skill; ability to organize, analyze, and effectively determine risk and appropriate response; ability to remain objective and separate facts from opinionsEffective oral and written communication, interpersonal and customer service skills; ability to interact with individuals at all levels and personalitiesEnergetic, persistent, and forward thinking with high ethical and professional standardsGood learning agility with the willingness to become a subject matter expert and thought leaderWorking ConditionsWhile performing the duties of this job, the employee works in normal office working conditions.DisclaimerThe job description describes the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this job and is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required. DutiesAmeriCorps recently launched Public Health AmeriCorps, a new partnership with the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention to support the recruitment, training, and development of a new generation of public health leaders who will be ready to respond to the nation's public health needs.Public Health AmeriCorps will help vulnerable communities recover from COVID-19 and address broader public health needs. This exciting new partnership builds upon the expertise, best practices, and lessons learned from both existing AmeriCorps and CDC programs to support communities and also provide much-needed surge capacity for state and local public health agencies that continue to bear the burden of caring for a nation in crisis. AmeriCorps members will serve in support of in state, local, Tribal, and territorial public health agencies.The incumbent will:Support the goals defined by the Chief Data Officer (CDO) for the maturation of Enterprise Data Management.Assist with coordination of vendors to support documenting the agency data landscape and to be roadmap.Lead the open data and data.gov initiatives for the agency including stewardship for each set of data.Facilitate data working groups consisting of business subject matter experts to enable data driven decisions.Participate in the implementation of Enterprise Data Governance and Stewardship.Lead the implementation of Enterprise Data Management Tools (Data Quality, Profiling, etc.)Define and prepares data for quality and analysis.Create clean and compelling data visualizations to summarize and communicate findings and trends across the agency.Develop and builds models to meet data management and operational requirements.Develop criteria of trusted data, guidance on its attributes, and stewardship.Educate other practitioners on the value of enterprise data management and supports adoption of best practices.Define best practices and methods for data manipulation, sourcing, and lineage. Develops training for data practitioners.Participate in evaluating new technologies to ensure the advancement of data architecture and data analytic needs.Implement strategies to optimize the statistical efficiency and quality of the data.Review information to identify and interpret any patterns or useful trends in complex sets of data.Work closely with management to prioritize business needs and stay up to date with the goals of the organization as they evolve.RequirementsConditions of EmploymentYou must be a United States CitizenA 2-year probationary period is required for new Federal employees and supervisors.Merit Promotion and internal applicants must submit a SF-50 to verify Status and gradeAs required by Executive Order 14043, all current and new Federal employees are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 no later than November 22, 2021. See the ADDITIONAL INFORMATION section for more details regarding this requirement.Satisfactory completion of a background investigation.Must be telework ready. See the ADDITIONAL INFORMATION section for more details regarding the agency's current full-time telework status.QualificationsApplicants must have one year of specialized experience comparable in scope and responsibility to at least the mid range of the NY-03 pay band, which would be at or equivalent to, the GS-12 level in the Federal Service. Specialized experience is that which has equipped the applicant with the particular knowledge, skills, and abilities to successfully perform the duties of the position, and that is typically in or related to the work of the position to be filled. Specialized experience includes deploying relational database design and structured query language (SQL), MicroStrategy, and Power BI AND utilizing database management systems and applying techniques and procedures for analysis, design, programming and documentation.Experience refers to paid and unpaid experience, including volunteer work done through National Service programs (e.g., Peace Corps, AmeriCorps VISTA) and other organizations (e.g., professional; philanthropic; religious; spiritual; community, student, social). Volunteer work helps build critical competencies, knowledge, and skills can provide valuable training and experience that translates directly to paid employment. You will receive credit for qualifying experience, including volunteer experience.Such experience must be clearly documented in the applicant's resume.Additional Selections: Additional selections may be made from this announcement or for similar positions across AmeriCorps. By applying, you agree to have your application shared with interested selecting official(s) at AmeriCorps.Term Employment: As a Term employee, you will not be covered be the agency's Interchange Agreement with the Office of Personnel Management, which allows for noncompetitive transfer from AmeriCorps to other agencies in the competitive service of the federal government.Additional informationCOVID-19 Vaccination Requirements: As required by Executive Order 14043, all Federal employees are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 no later than November 22, 2021, regardless of the employee's duty location or work arrangement (e.g., telework, remote work, etc.), and subject only to such exceptions as required by law. Therefore, even if you are selected for a position on or before November 22, 2021, you will be required to be vaccinated against COVID-19 and submit documentation of proof of vaccination by November 22, 2021, or before appointment or onboarding with the agency. If you are selected, your offer letter will contain additional information regarding how to request a reasonable accommodation legally required exception from this requirement to the vaccination requirement based on medical or religious factors.Expanded Telework Status Due to COVID-19: Due to COVID-19, the agency is currently in an expanded telework posture.
