Who We AreFrontierView is a leading market intelligence and advisory firm that supports the international growth mandates of multinationals in the Healthcare, Consumer, B2B, and Technology sectors. FrontierView provides clients with a range of subscription offerings as well as custom research solutions to help inform their strategic planning, market growth and ongoing market monitoring initiatives. FrontierView is headquartered in Washington, DC with offices in London and Singapore. For more information, please visit https://www.frontierview.com.At FrontierView, we are invested in working collectively from all corners of the globe to meet the dynamic challenges of changing market conditions and the ever-evolving business priorities of our client executives. In our three offices around the world, our leadership strives to create a culturally diverse, stimulating, and creative atmosphere where every employee can reach their individual best. FrontierView offers a competitive salary, bonus, and comprehensive benefit plan.As we look to grow, we are seeking a Data Analyst to join our FrontierView Product Development team. Reporting into the Practice Leader, this role will support the maintenance, improvement, and expansion of our proprietary FrontierData data asset and econometric model, consisting of more than 360,000 data series across more than 200 countries.Job Description and Key ResponsibilitiesDay-to-day responsibilities span across multiple projects and enhancements, including:Manage data process through data processing, data management (investigating bugs, answering questions, fixing errors, adding data indicators, collecting data), in collaboration with FrontierView research team with high degree of QA adherence.Help develop and maintain new and cutting-edge econometric approach(es) to advance our forecast accuracy.Run and maintain R scripts designed to forecast macroeconomic time series dataConstantly improve the breadth and depth of FrontierData through identifying and vetting new data sourcesServing as a point of contact for data inquiries for internal and external users of data productsResearch and help support the enhancement of data forecasting algorithms, through new diagnostic and benchmarking tools/surveys/frameworks/etc.Qualifications & Experience:The successful candidate should have the following qualifications:Bachelor’s degree required, preferably Master’s degree, in Statistics, Mathematics, or Economics with relevant intern or work experience.Well versed in econometric modeling and advanced analyticsEntrepreneurial mindset with interest in growing and developing FrontierView product offering and client-facing analytics practiceMust have programming skills: SQL, R, Python all preferredExperience with large and complex data setsMust understand basic statistical analysisBasic descriptive statistics, regression, correlationAdvanced statistics preferred – time series analysis, multivariate regression, machine learningMust have advanced Excel knowledge: Able to use pivot tables, graphs and advanced functions (VLOOKUP, IFELSE, VBA, etc.)Must have an interest in international business and global economicsHighly innovative and able to handle multiple projects in a fast-paced environmentAble to work independently as well as collaborate in a team environmentApplication Process:This position can be located in the US from the Washington, D.C. office or remote. To be considered, interested candidates must submit a resume and cover letter, including salary requirements.FrontierView is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including sexual orientation or gender identity), national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or any other classification protected by law.

Come join the true partner of global healthcare companies who builds transformational solutions by challenging the boundaries of commercialization strategies to improve the lives of patients.Strategic Data AnalystRemoteCurrent opportunity exists for a Strategic Data Analyst. This is a full time, salaried position. Amplity provides a base salary, competitive benefits, including medical, dental, vision, 401K, PTO, paid holidays and more. Residence near a major airport, and location in the East or Central US preferred.Position Summary :The Strategic Data Analyst will be a critical part of our evolving strategy and future growth. As a Strategic Data Analyst, you will be responsible for evaluating data/information to improve decision-making, improve impact and increase performance. You will work with key clients and stakeholders to better understand current performance, evaluate options, and inform the future strategic direction of our teams. You will challenge the unknown and drive improvement into critical areas of our business.A successful candidate knows and loves working with data and people - passionately partnering with the business to identify strategic opportunities and deliver results. They should have an internal drive to answer “why?” questions, excellent analytical abilities, solid business acumen, as well as superior written and verbal communication skills. The Strategic Data Analyst should be a self-starter, comfortable with ambiguity, and able to think big (while paying careful attention to detail). The opportunity looks like this...Simpluris seeks to hire a contract Data Analyst (with opportunity for permanent role) based out of our Orlando area operations. We are looking for an individual with a naturally analytical and curious mind who can see past the surface and understand the depth and complexities of the various issues a particular problem possesses and whom can identify clear paths to solutions. They must be able to view a problem from multiple angles and aspects to understand the client's needs. Most of our data projects are presented in a word problem type format which must be read and the project requirements extrapolated out from. This position requires working with our project management team in receiving various types and sources of data, interpreting and developing data project requirements, and utilizing tools such as Python, Excel, and SQL to cleanse, transform, and perform calculations against data as necessary for internal and external systems. The ideal candidate will have advanced Microsoft Excel skills, some experience utilizing Python or SQL, flourishes in a team dynamic, and possesses a passion for efficient and real world data applications. This opportunity is best suited for the self-starter who enjoys solving problems and wishes to be part of a fast-paced environment where they might challenge themselves and expand their knowledge and experience.RequirementsHere is what we need from you...Proficiency in data manipulation using MS Excel (Pivot Tables, VLOOKUP, etc.), SQL (SELECT/JOIN), and/or Python (Pandas, NumPy)Ability to succinctly explain and thoroughly document steps of data analysisAbility to follow instructions / SOP’s and develop new SOP’sAbility to self-manage and work independently as neededAbility to communicate data issues effectively to non-technical usersHere is what you will be doing...Perform data cleansing/de-duplication/merging/calculation/analysisDeal with various forms and sources of data utilizing tools including Microsoft Excel, SQL, R & PythonInterpret and develop project data and calculation requirementsIdentifying and developing improved processes and workflowsPrioritize, organize, and audit work effectively against deadlinesInterface with internal/external staff & clients (technical & non-technical) directly resolving issues with dataSkillsets we’re looking for...Solid critical thinking, analytical, and problem solving abilitiesComfort with basic algebra, logic, and statisticsStrong interpersonal communication skills (both oral and written)High proficiency (i.e. Power User) in Microsoft Excel with knowledge of VLOOKUP, pivot tables, and other advanced functionsSome experience with a programming language (e.g. SQL, C#, JavaScript) a plusPython or R experience preferredAbility to learn new tools and business processes quicklyPrior experience performing ETL (extract, transform, and load) functions a plusPrior experience with reporting (e.g., SSRS) or dashboarding (e.g., PowerBI) a plusEducation with majors related to IT/MIS, accounting, math, or similar programsBenefitsIf you think you have what it takes, come join our growing team of purpose driven people! This is a full time, permanent position and compensation is commensurate with experience. We offer benefits such as medical, dental, vision, life insurance and 401k plus bonus opportunities. Please submit salary requirements along with resume.This is who we are…Find out more about Simpluris, our company, our people, and our culture here:https://www.simpluris.comhttps://www.linkedin.com/company/simpluris-inc

ABOUT US: Foreground is a platform of products that connects families and individuals with world-class photographers. The Foreground family of brands helps photographers and photo consumers create memories that last a lifetime by giving them access to tremendous software, professional services, supportive education and high quality photo products and custom gifts.As a Foreground brand, Collage makes the creation of custom products easy for everyone, by providing superior software and excellent customer service. We sell an expanding variety of photo and home products, including photo blankets, photo books, canvases, pillows, and more.ABOUT THE ROLE:We are seeking a Data Analyst to lead us in making optimal, data-driven decisions about our investments in our products and how we can best use our limited resources throughout the company. You will work collaboratively with internal stakeholders on the product team (engineers, UX, and product managers) to communicate findings, answer business questions, improve existing processes and create innovative new data solutions. You will primarily focus on driving growth and optimizing our business decisions by designing and analyzing experiments, undertaking compelling analysis projects, and building self-service analysis reports. You will serve as a subject matter expert supporting modeling and analytics needs across other areas in the company, including product, data infrastructure, e-commerce, operations, marketing, and customer success. As a data analyst, you’ll be expected to understand the tradeoffs between experimental and non-experimental estimates and determine which methods are appropriate for given stakeholder needs. You’ll have the opportunity to own larger research projects that may include a series of randomized and quasi-experiments. The ideal candidate will be highly self-motivated and inquisitive, with strong analytical skills, extreme attention to detail, and a passion for using data to drive business growth.The ideal candidate will be a flexible subject matter expert highly self-motivated and inquisitive, with strong analytical skills, extreme attention to detail, and a passion for using data to drive business growth.Duties and ResponsibilitiesDesign, develop and maintain robust and scalable solutions, reports, dashboards, etc., that will support our internal stakeholders’ ongoing and ad-hoc needs.Create and maintain real-time alerts and reports that identify possible problems with vendor partners so that the operations team can get ahead of potential disruptions.Apply analytical, data-driven research throughout the company, across teams, including product, data infrastructure, e-commerce, operations, marketing, and customer success. Work with internal stakeholders in various areas to correctly frame and answer high-level, open-ended business questions. Verify and validate the accuracy and precision of data, documentation, processes, and conclusions.Partner with the marketing team to design and analyze experiments to optimize pricing, ad bidding, ad copy, etc. By creating quasi-experiments that utilize difference-in-differences, regression discontinuity, and synthetic control modeling.Collaborate on user experience funnel and attribution modeling to identify how users interact with our site and improve conversion, retention, and upgrade rates.Collaborate on user experience funnel and attribution modeling to identify how users interact with our site and improve conversion, retention, and upgrade rates.Collaborate with product PMs to assess the ROI of new features and initiatives to pursue.You will stand out if you have:Experience with machine learning techniquesExperience with Google Analytics and digital advertising tracking, measurement, and metrics is preferred Advanced knowledge of the latest research and literature regarding tools and methods that will further develop our analytics capabilitiesCompensation, Benefits and CultureHighly competitive compensation packageBenefits include comprehensive medical, dental, and vision insurance, and 401K with 4% company matchA culture that promotes a healthy work-life balance including a flexible PTO planThis position is 100% remote and you can work from anywhere (subject to legal review)

The Research Coordinator/Data Analyst (RC/DA) will be part of the Department of Human and Organizational Development within the Peabody College at Vanderbilt University and report functionally to a Principal Investigator (PI) who conducts social and behavioral sciences research in domestic and international settings. The RC/DA will be primarily responsible for coordinating research activities across various global health research projects, and assisting with quantitative data analyses and manuscript preparation. The PI’s research projects focus on the role that social norms and social networks play in shaping health behaviors and attitudes. The RC/DA will spend significant time contributing both in a coordinator capacity and an analytical capacity to the PI’s National Institute of Health (NIH) grant focused on HIV prevention and behavioral health in Uganda. The RC/DA should be comfortable working with team members with different and frequently changing schedules as the RC/DA will communicate and coordinate between the PI, research partners, and graduate and undergraduate students. A typical day may start with updating project timelines, check-ins with student workers, drafting grant-related progress reports, and then the afternoon spent cleaning and analyzing data for various manuscripts or contributing to manuscripts/presentations. There are several ongoing projects, so the RC/DA should be prepared to have different daily tasks, as needed and directed by the PI. This is a great opportunity for someone with a background in quantitative research who is thinking about applying to PhD programs in Global Health, Health Policy, Social Epidemiology, Social Psychology, or a similar social and behavioral sciences program. There is also opportunity to tailor this position to someone with a PhD in a related field who is interested in furthering their research, writing, and analytical skills as part of a research team. This position can be remote for the immediate future, but the successful candidate will be expected to be located in Nashville, TN sometime in the future. Exceptions will be considered for exceptional candidates. Ideally, this person would be able to remain in this position for at least 2 years pending funding availability.This is a term position. A term position is a staff position that exists for a period longer than six months but is not expected to last beyond one year. Although a position may exist for a specified or indefinite period, staff who accept term positions are not guaranteed employment for the entire period; they are employed for indefinite periods within the limit of the appointment. There are no guarantees of continued employment, either within the term or when the term ends.With a genealogy dating to a one-room Nashville schoolhouse in 1785, Peabody College today is a world-class college of education and human development. Our mission is to enhance the human condition. We do this as we always have, through the preparation of leaders; through cycles of research, implementation, and refinement; through service to families, schools, and communities; and through external engagement with professionals, leaders, and policy-makers. Peabody is devoted to creating opportunity in an increasingly diverse society and to solving large societal problems. The Department of Human and Organizational Development is an academic department within Peabody College and represents a group of interdisciplinary programs that share a focus on community and organizational development, health, and wellbeing, and social justice-oriented research and action.Duties and ResponsibilitiesResearch CoordinationOrganizes, reviews, and maintains appropriate About the job:The Red Hat Digital Experience Analytics team is looking for a Web Optimization Data Analyst to join us. In this role, you will help shape the future of the digital optimization analytics program focusing on website A/B and multivariate testing and web personalization program reporting, connected to projects that are foundational to Red Hat’s strategic priorities. You will develop measurement strategies, align hypotheses to web testing and personalization opportunities, create reports and dashboards, present insights and recommendations, and help shape the digital optimization program roadmap. You will work closely with the Personalization Program Manager as well as cross functional digital marketing teams to create a positive and differentiated web experience for Red Hat’s global customers. Silverwork is the future of mortgage automation, and we are looking for a Data Analytics Lead to guide our Reporting and Analytics team and collaborate with our BOT experts and product analysts.Who we are:Silverwork understands how cognitive technologies can be best applied to dramatically improve a client’s business operations. We use technologies such as software robotics, machine learning, and document recognition to create intelligent automation that is purpose built for the mortgage industry.Our software robots (BOTs) provide our clients with a digital workforce that can be easily added to their current manual operating model. This new digital workforce is fast, intelligent, and easy to operate. Our solutions and engineering teams help our clients move quickly to realize the benefits of our intelligent automation.We are thought leaders in applying cognitive technologies for mortgage. Our approach includes sharing our vision for Intelligent Automation and bringing our passion for leveraging cognitive technology to provide our clients with exciting first-of-its-kind automation.We attract people who like working with the latest technology and enjoy creating advanced automation. We like to have fun at work and take pride in creating great software. We are committed to the professional and personal growth of our employees. We celebrate and respect each other as humans first and employees second. While we are still in startup growth mode, we are poised to do great things and need your help. Work with us!What you’ll be doing:As Data Analytics Team Lead, you will lead, mentor, and grow a small group of talented data and machine learning analysts. In turn, you will help drive the strategy and execution of the analytics behind our automation. With your experience in ETL, cleansing data, and NL modelling, you’ll be the SME for your team while continuing to be hands-on with the data produced by our automation bots. The role is perfect for data scientists interested in people management and eager to impact an exciting and evolving tech company on the cutting edge of role automation.Requirements:What you bring:Approximately 3-7+ years of data analyst experience, especially in ETL, data cleansing, and NL modeling1-2 years of experience leading small teamsExposure to machine learning toolsFamiliarity with visualization tools like TableauAbility to achieve results by balancing working independently and collaborating with othersA curious mind and excitement for learning new concepts quicklyA desire to be a thought leader for your team and the companySolid critical thinking and problem-solving skillsPlease note: At this time, we unfortunately are not equipped for visa sponsorship.What you get:The chance to make an impact at a growing fintech startupWide-ranging learning opportunitiesCompetitive salary with generous bonus opportunitiesUnlimited PTOProfit-sharing and 401kAccess to a financial advisorMedical benefitsFlexible scheduleOpportunity for remote work/WFH, as well as options for hybrid work in our River North Chicago office when we return in 2022Regular social eventsWe recognize that some applicants, especially those with the most diverse backgrounds, will refrain from applying to postings where they don’t fit 100% of the criteria. We urge you to apply anyway. Silverwork is committed to hiring for skill and experience through a fair and consistent interview process. That being said, we are not currently equipped for visa sponsorship.Category:Data + Analytics

Don’t just land a job. Launch your future.Our all-in-one software platform gives HR pros a way to easily manage daily tasks in payroll, benefits, talent, and workforce management.But what makes us different is that our technology is backed by a culture that cares. We care about our team members, clients, and partners – because people matter most. And people have always been at the heart of our business.Since our founding in 1997, this is the thing that's stayed the same, from our employees to the millions of users nationwide that access our platform. We pride ourselves on partnering with our clients to build the workplace they and their employees crave.Let's go forward together.Position Overview:Paylocity’s Partner Integration team is responsible for exchanging data between our Payroll, HR, Time and Labor, and Online Benefit Enrollment products and public and private cloud-based partners which our clients use to facilitate HR-related business processes such as 401(k), benefits, banking, Insurance, and human capital management. The function is vital to Paylocity as the ability to distribute data accurately and effectively is key to executing a cloud-based software business model and enabling the technical interfaces with underpinning our extremely important broker channel sales strategy.Benefit Integration Analysts are responsible for setting up electronic eligibility feeds and COBRA file feeds between Paylocity’s Web Benefits systems and outside vendors. The analyst is responsible for all aspects of file feed set up from the initial vendor meetings to the use of systems to properly configure integration files, and finally to testing and scheduling the files with our vendor partners. Additionally, the Analyst may be responsible for tasks such as interface maintenance and interface auditing to ensure that all files were sent and received. Lastly, an Analyst may be responsible for supporting internal, external, and vendor customers who call in with questions on interface content.The most successful Benefit Integration Analysts are people who really enjoy solving puzzles. A strong commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion is critical to creating such a culture.We’ve made great strides to support diversity, equity, and inclusion. That being said, we realize there’s still room for improvement. Base pay information is based on market location. Applicants should apply via www.paylocity.com/careers.

At Seer, we pride ourselves on innovation; standing out among the rest and enabling our clients to do the same. We're a Digital Marketing Agency powered by Big Data to drive integrated, holistic strategy for our clients. We get excited at the thought of bringing together millions of data points from disparate data sets (including qualitative!) to drive empathy-fueled opportunities and insights. Big Data, automation, and problem solving at scale: it's what's for breakfast. Could this be love? Maybe.Not the right location for ya? Don't worry- this position can sit in San Diego, or remote.What about you? You’re data-obsessed and love solving problems at scale. You pay attention to the details without losing sight of the big picture. Quick to pick up patterns and patient enough to identify long-term trends. You’re detail-oriented, logical, and running head first towards the future of search.Here are some highlights of what you'll be doing...You’ll execute and measure the effectiveness of Seer’s Paid Media strategies through an integrated approach to search, growing your expertise across a variety of paid channels (Paid Search, Paid Social, Display, Programmatic, and more!!) and collaborating closely with SEO to best serve your clientsYou’ll leverage big data to make keyword recommendations at scale. Rooting your analysis and client recommendations in both paid and organic dataYou will unlock new opportunities for clients and save hours of valuable time through automation and machine learning, leveraging Paid Media management platforms and analyzing data at scaleYou’ll create + test ad copy and landing pages rooted in data to ensure that customers have the most relevant experience, driving optimal results for your clientsYou’ll spend your days in the data. Keeping client goals and target audiences top of mind, you pull insights from time of day data, geographic location, user's search funnel (and more!) to drive holistic, data-driven optimizations- maximizing ROI and saving clients money *cha-ching*We're big on knowledge sharing, and you are too!! You'll contribute to the Seer blog, industry forums, and grow your thought leadership skills from the ground upThe skills you'll bring to the table...Your exposure to Paid Media stretches across various platforms [Google Ads, Bing Ads, Facebook, LinkedIn, and Twitter]You take your client's success personally. It shines through your analysis of client performance- managing large data sets across multiple channels to protect your clients' dollars. Automation is your friend. Between Supermetrics and Google Data Studio, you're able to keep a close pulse on how we're pacing and never miss a beatYou know the world of Paid Media changes fast! To keep pace, you're all over the latest emerging trends, tools, and technologies. Reading industry blogs and case studies, then bringing them back to share and level up your teamNo doubt you’re results-oriented. Your killer attention to detail allows you to thoroughly analyze Big Data across disparate data sources, extracting valuable insights for your clientsEven though your role focuses largely on strategy implementation, you’re always eager to share your ideas- transforming technical insights into easily digestible recommendationsAdvanced skills with Microsoft Office, especially Excel, and the Google Suite. Savvy with data viz tools like Power BI or Tableau too? Say no more!Your top-notch time management skills allow you to juggle several projects at once without missing a beat. When faced with a challenge, you always rise to the occasion. You’re no stranger to working under pressure and you always find a way to meet deadlinesBonus PointsWhile you're building your digital marketing skills, they already stretch beyond Paid Media- you have a grasp on Excel, Google Suite, data viz tools and you have an A+ in data literacy. You have a baseline understanding of data sources and constructs, the basics of SQL, and more! Most importantly, you know when there's an opportunity at your fingertips and are quick to loop-in the resident Data Analyst & Engineer to make it a realityNot ready to apply but want to keep in touch? Stay connected via our monthly Career Update newsletter! We'll share curated content on Seer, open roles, industry insights, career advice, events you don't want to miss, and more (so you never miss a beat).Sometimes the best opportunities are hidden by self-doubt. We disqualify ourselves before we have the opportunity to be considered. Regardless of where you came from, how you identify, or the path that led you here- you are welcome. If you read this job description with a belly full of excitement, we’re just as excited about you. You have to apply though :)#LI-Remote

TURNING DATA INTO IMPACT!BackgroundSocial Progress Imperative is a small but mighty nonprofit team that leverages the power of its global network and strategic partnerships to model and amplify the use of data to influence policies and investments to better serve all humanity. We partner with leaders across every sector––government, business, and civil society––to meet the pressing needs of communities and equip them with the right information to tackle urgent global challenges like Covid-19 and climate change.Our flagship data-driven tool, the Social Progress Index, captures how well a society converts its resources into social and environmental outcomes on things that matter most, measuring whether people have what they need to prosper—from basic needs like adequate shelter, being well-nourished, and feeling safe, to whether they are treated equally regardless of gender, race, or sexual orientation to help improve the quality of life for all.This data has real power. Innovative leaders in more than 45 countries from Europe to India, from Silicon Valley to the rainforests of the Amazon have adopted the Social Progress Index to help identify and prioritize the most pressing social issues in their communities and shape policies, investments, and actions that drive social impact. To learn more about the Index and our pioneering work, visit Social Progress Imperative’s website (socialprogress.org) and watch our CEO’s TED Talks.As a member of the Social Progress Imperative team, the Data Analyst will be part of an exciting stage of growth and impact globally. Working closely with the Data Analytics and Insights Manager and other team members around the world, the Data Analyst will help respond to the increasing demand for sub-national partnerships and products, leveraging our experience, strategic partnerships, and investments in technology to deliver insights at a much broader scale. This includes accelerating the use and adoption of the Social Progress Index and other tools by investing in a more expansive and robust technical platform to deliver insights and data more effectively.This is a temporary position to start immediately for an extent of three months. ABOUT THE PROJECTThe Rooted in Trust project works to combat COVID-19 rumors and misinformation in Afghanistan, Lebanon, Iraq, Zimbabwe, Colombia, Brazil, Mali, DRC, Sudan and South Sudan. We work to create impact at the local level and inform approaches to rumor management at the global level. The project is supported by a Global Technical Advisory team made up of media, humanitarian, data science and information management experts.In Phase 1 of the project, we collected more than 19 thousand rumors in 14 languages and supported more than 30 local trusted information providers. In this critical phase of the pandemic, we will build on these efforts to listen and respond to the information challenges faced by vulnerable groups in humanitarian contexts, encouraging open dialogue between citizens and scientists and stronger and more collaborative partnerships between information providers (such as local media) and humanitarian and health sources.ABOUT THE OPPORTUNITYThe Social Media Data Analyst is tasked with wrangling qualitative and quantitative rumor data collected from various social media platforms in Afghanistan. The Data Analyst (DA) will work to find trends and information to help us better understand community perceptions of the pandemic, vaccines, and other health issues, as well as access to humanitarian services, information and technology. The DA will work with a team of social media monitors to ensure qualitative data is collected in a consistent and continuous way and analyzing feedback with a focus on the concerns, fears and hopes that are behind rumors and drive misinformation. The DA will support the Internews team to address misinformation and provide input for feedback reports for humanitarian partners on national and regional levels to inform decision-making and improve information provision with timely, locally relevant and reliable information people trust.LOGISTICSThis is a remote-first position based outside of Afghanistan. All remote candidates will be considered. However, you must have work authorization in your location that does not require sponsorship from Internews. Additionally, there are locations in which Internews is not able to support fully remote work.OUR COMMITMENT TO FOSTERING A CULTURE OF BELONGINGWe are an organization of dynamic, mission-driven individuals who are passionate about our core values and about supporting positive changes in the world. We pride ourselves on our commitment to innovation and flexibility. We believe that diverse teams are strong teams and work to support an ethic of belonging, dignity, and justice for all people. Our current team includes a mix of genders, parents and non-parents, and people of multiple races, nationalities, ages, sexual orientations, and socioeconomic backgrounds. We are an EEO employer and encourage candidates of all races, genders, ages, orientations, and national origins to apply, and welcome those with alternative backgrounds and experiences.DAY-TO-DAY TASKS will include: Lead the analysis of qualitative and quantitative rumor data collected by social media monitors and identify trends that may impact public health outcomes and the provision of humanitarian services;Keep up to date with the latest trends in social media practices both within Afghanistan and the diaspora community;Support feedback gathering by Internews staff and partners by evaluating methodology and suggesting improvements where necessary;Contribute to the production of regular reports for humanitarian and health partners to improve their understanding of the concerns and questions among the affected population;Work alongside and collaborate with researchers, journalists, and humanitarian communicators;Provide input into research activities by sharing recurrent or emerging topics and trends from social media data and practices;Support monitoring and evaluation activities to assess impact, reach, and quality of the project;Perform any other duties as assigned by the supervisors; andIn all duties, an understanding of and demonstrated commitment to upholding Internews' Core Values.QUALIFICATIONS WE'RE LOOKING FORProfessional proficiency in English and Dari and/or Pashto requiredStrong qualitative dat analysis, research, and information management experience in fast-changing humanitarian contexts and with variable social media datasetsExperience working with sentiment analysis and social media analytics tools such as TalkwalkerA good understanding of social media trends in Afghanistan including preferred platformsData visualization skills and knowledge of relevant software to produce infographics a plusStrong writing skills and the ability to bring data to lifeExperience working in humanitarian and/or health emergenciesStrong understanding of, and commitment towards editorial values of the projectSelf-motivated and able to work in a fast-paced environmentPreferredNote: Candidates who do not have these preferred qualifications, but are interested and willing to learn, are encouraged to apply.Awareness of, and familiarity with, the issues and dynamics of the COVID-19 pandemic in Afghanistan and/or other health crises in humanitarian contexts a strong asset.This position is being offered and hired by Internews Network. Benefits will be consistent with Internews Network's offerings and will be reviewed during the hiring process. Additional information can be found on our About Working for Internews page.Job Type: Full-timeWork Location: Multiple Locations
